description: From Latin anemōnē, from Ancient Greek ἀνεμώνη (anemṓnē), from ἄνεμος (ánemos, “wind”) + matronymic suffix -ώνη (-ṓnē, “daughter of the wind”).
Or from Phoenician *𐤍𐤏𐤌𐤍‎ (*nʿmn), akin to Arabic شَقَائِق اَلنُّعْمَان‎ (šaqāʔiq an-nuʕmān, “anemones”) and Hebrew (Isaiah Scroll) נִטְעֵי נַעֲמָנִים‎ (nit'ei na'amanim, “plants of pleasantness”).

entries.meaning: Any plant of the genus Anemone, of the Ranunculaceae (or buttercup) family, such as the windflower.
